comments.body: [~nathanxu]: I will initialize/configure Chinese locale for the console.  Do we need traditional Chinese (zh_HANT) or simplified Chinese (zh_HANS) support?
It's better to have simple Chinese at first, we have propsects in China require it.  but traditional Chinese should be able to added later on

Simplified and traditional Chinese catalogs are initialized in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/767

[~nathanxu]: I will provide instructions on how to add translations as part of GUI-1056 after pull request 767 is merged.

[~nathanxu]: The translation file for simplified Chinese is available for review in pull request 767 at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/GUI-1055/eucaconsole/locale/zh_HANS/LC_MESSAGES/eucaconsole.po

You can test a translation by adding a translation in the msgstr for each string you want to translate.  For example, if you want to translate "select…" at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/GUI-1055/eucaconsole/locale/zh_HANS/LC_MESSAGES/eucaconsole.po#L73 , you will need to replace the empty placeholder string at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/GUI-1055/eucaconsole/locale/zh_HANS/LC_MESSAGES/eucaconsole.po#L74 with the translation.

Feel free to try a translation on the GUI-1055 branch if you have a local install of the console to work with.  We can add more translations later after the test succeeds and pull request 767 is merged.
Thansk, I will finish the translation soon

[~nathanxu]: I forgot to mention that after you add the translations to the eucaconsole.po file, run "make translations" at the repo root to generate/compile the translations.  See https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/develop/README.rst#configuring-i18n
[~nathanxu]: Steps for contributing a translation are documented at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/wiki/Contributing-Translations

[~kgill] the original *.po seems not be able to compile to *,mo due to uft-8 decode error, so I re-initiate the zh_HANS and done half of of the translation, it works, I already run the eucaconsole in my local lab. I should be able to finish the whole translation in this week. great job kamal!

[~kgill] I finish the translation,but something need to be  confirmed

1) seems the top menu can't be translated. I check the template "top_nav.pt", there are no i18n supported
2) some of tanslation doesn't work in my lab, like messages in "tag_editor.pt" and "landingpage_filters.pt" can't be translated

[~nathanxu]: Looks as though top_nav.pt is missing a few i18n:translate attributes, and the tag_editor.pt and other files are missing the i18n:domain attributes.  I can add those to the GUI-1055 branch.  btw, what branch are you working on?  Would it be fine if I make those fixes to the GUI-1055 branch?
Yes, GUI-1055

[~nathanxu]: Ok, I don't see your changes on branch GUI-1055.  I can commit my changes to that branch, but it may cause a merge conflict if you have changes to the GUI-1055 that you haven't committed and pushed yet.  Could you push your changes to GitHub, or should I make my fixes on that branch and you can merge from it later?

[~nathanxu]: I've opened (and will work on) GUI-1065 to track fixes for the i18n issues affecting the top nav, tag editor, and elsewhere.  Feel free to continue working on GUI-1055, and we can merge the fixes into the GUI-1055 branch after GUI-1065 has been implemented.
[~kgill] I didn't push back my changes, I can work GUI-1056 directly. thanks
[~nathanxu]: GUI-1065 has been implemented and merged into develop, which was merged into GUI-1055.
[~kgill] I all ready finish the translation and submit the pull request for GUI-1055
[~nathanxu]: We can't merge https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/780 due to merge conflicts at the moment.  Could you resolve the conflicts on your fork/branch?
[~nathanxu], [~kgill]: I'm not sure how to verify the fix for this.  Can you give me some instructions how to check this?
[~ccassler]: I verify it by configure the item "pyramid.default_locale_name = zh_HANS", then start eucaconsole, you can see the chinese console

This isn't working on my current build.  I set this value in /etc/eucaconsole/console.ini 'pyramid.default_locale_name = zh_HANS' and restarted eucaconsole.

The console still appears in English.

[~ccassler] if you build the  eucaconsole from source codes. need to compile it and install i18 translation to support that. please refer to the README doc in the source repository. here is the whole process from my side.
1) Download the source code from github
2) The translations require Babel and lingua, which can be install via `pip install -e .[i18n]`
3) generate the translation files, run 'make translations' at the repo root
4) edit the console.ini , set the default locale to "zh_HANS"

Btw, you also need configure your browser's language preference, to add simple chinese (zh_HANs).
make sure the http request header "Accept-Language" include value "zh_HANs"

[~kgill]: please correct me if something are wrong.

[~ccassler]: You will need to set your browser's language preference to simplified Chinese, since the console detects the browser's language setting before reading from the console.ini setting.  

In Chrome, go to Preferences > Settings > Show advanced settings, click the "Language and input settings…" button, then be sure to add "Chinese (simplified Han)" to the list of language and drag it to the top to set it as the preferred language.
